standard_metadata.standard_description: Represent three-dimensional figures using nets made up of rectangles and triangles, and use the nets to find the surface area of these figures. Apply these techniques in the context of solving real-world and mathematical problems.

question.content: **Identify the shape that can be formed using the following net.**  $\qquad\qquad$$\qquad\qquad$

images.alt: A net that has 4 triangles. 3 triangles are attached to the 3 sides of 1 triangle.
A cube with equal side lengths and surface area.
A figure made up of 2 rectangular pyramids. There are 8 total faces.
A triangular pyramid. There are 4 total faces.
A rectangular prism.

hints.content: This net is made up of $4$ triangles.  Let’s see what the nets of the figures in the answer choices look like.

The nets of these figures do not have any triangles, so these are not correct.   $\qquad\qquad$    $\qquad$      The net of this figure contains $8$ triangles, so it is not correct, either.    $\qquad\qquad$$\qquad\qquad$  [[☃ image 1]]

images.alt: A figure made up of 2 rectangular pyramids. There are 8 total faces.
A cube with all 6 sides equal.
A rectangular prism with 4 sides equal and 2 ends equal. It has a total of 6 sides.

hints.content: This figure is a  tetrahedron.  Its net  is made up of  $4$ triangles.   $\qquad\qquad$$\qquad\qquad$   [[☃ image 1]]  If we fold the net, it will form a tetrahedron.

images.alt: A triangular pyramid. There are 4 total faces.

hints.content: The correct answer is:   $\qquad\qquad$$\qquad\qquad$

images.alt: A triangular pyramid. There are 4 total faces.
